SENT.plain: Granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF) was given concurrently with low-dose cytosine arabinoside for 3 weeks to patients with myelodysplasia
Neutrophil activation as evidenced by increased chemiluminescence and reduced surface expression of CD16 was consistently seen during therapy
An attendant fall in chemotaxis was also observed
These effects occurred even when neutrophil counts did not rise significantly at lower doses of GM-CSF
Although no improvement in anaemia or thrombocytopenia was observed, the neutrophil counts became normal during therapy without significant expansion of marrow cellularity or colony-forming ability
No major toxicities were observed, even at higher dosages of GM-CSF
